turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Liberating isn't it?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Y'know it is, a bit.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Vincenzo, that fat motherfucker, Yakavetta's right hand. He's the one who set me up. Then he went around shooting his mouth off, telling everyone I was as good as dead. He goes in there every Wednesday night around 10:00, he jerks off in the same booth to the same titty dancer. Never misses.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: So?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: So let's kill the motherfucker. I mean, what are you guys... like that's your new thing right?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Well, truth be known, those first ones just kinda fell into our laps.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Well, what'ya do?

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You look like Mush Mouth from Fat Albert.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Fine! Fuck it! When we're done she can I.D. me. I don't care. Just tryin' to be professional, but no...

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Worst day of my life, man.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Well, I'm sold.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: Well he sure as fuck knew you!

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Fuck you both! Ya ask me, he was aiming at you!

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Shit!... Shit! He ain't here.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: What the fuck do you mean?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: I mean he ain't here.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: You bet your ass he will.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Well, I'd say that makes him a lia- fuckin-bility.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Hey! We gotta talk about this early morning church shit.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We have to go now.  We're on the lamb.

turns.speaker: MURPHY
turns.text: We'll keep going, Roc.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: You'll make it outta here. You can't ever stop, not ever.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Hello? You there?

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Y-Yes my son.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Why have you come to a church for council if you're not religious?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Why have I come to a church? I never have before. I guess I just... felt I should.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: What is it my son?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: It's ethics. I put evil men behind bars, but the law has miles of red tape and loopholes for these... cocksuckers to slip through. I've found out there are these two young men who fix the situation with an iron fist. As if they have God's permission. But what they do is wrong and I should arrest them... technically.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: God's permission? God doesn't...

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: But in this day and age I believe what they do is... necessary. I feel it is... correct.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: You believe?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: You feel?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: You feel? A soul is what gives you feelings. Happiness, guilt, right or wrong. It is a conduit through which the Lord speaks to us. You felt that your answers would be here in the house of God today. You feel these men are necessary. The Lord has spoken to you twice this day.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Has he now?

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: You have entered the house of the Lord of your own free will speaking of beliefs and feelings. Is it so much to believe that God has brought you here?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: I guess not.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: It is easy to be sarcastic about religion. It is harder to take small hints from God, your feelings and listen to them... to take a stand.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: You're right.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Those who do not act are in a constant state of ethical indecision.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: I want to stand for what I believe in, father.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Then you must find out what your beliefs are.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: I believe these young men are right.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: You know them personally?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Do you think they would harm an innocent man, for any reason?

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: No. They would never do that.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: The laws of God are higher than the laws of man.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Yes! Yes! I was thinking that, too. No. I was feeling it. All I needed was to hear you say it! Amen! I'll help them.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Forgive me father.

turns.speaker: SMECKER
turns.text: Thank you, Father, thank you.  Whatever. Goodbye, amen.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: You gonna do what I say, got it?

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: I'm sorry you're gonna hafta see this. Don't look at me!

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I didn't see.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Shut up! Shut the fuck up!

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Don't do this my son.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Open it!

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Have you no fear of God?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: That's who I'm doing this for, now open the fuckin' thing.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Father, I'll do you right here.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: God have mercy on my soul.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Do your thing Father. Don't fuck this up.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: What do you want me to say?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Just be natural, goddamit.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: How long since your last confession, my son?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: I wouldn't have, uh, killed you, Father.  Dominus Ominus. Remember, you're bound. You can't talk about this... to anyone.

turns.speaker: PRIEST
turns.text: Just go!

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Poppa Joe, you want me to go now?

turns.speaker: YAKAVETTA
turns.text: Yeah. Thanks, Rocco. See ya.

turns.speaker: YAKAVETTA
turns.text: Hey, Rocco, wait. Come back here.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Yeah boss?

turns.speaker: YAKAVETTA
turns.text: I always see you talking to the boys and making them laugh. They always come around telling me what a crack up you are. What is it they call you?

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: The... The funny man.

turns.speaker: YAKAVETTA
turns.text: The funny man. Well, I got a new job for you, just for now. Roc, I'm having a real shitty day. I'm depressed. Tell me a funny story or a joke.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Uh. Okay... um... you hear the one about the, no fuck that one... uh... oh! oh! Well... shit. Okay, there's a white guy. He's walkin' along the beach and he finds a, a pot, y'know and ah, he rubs it and this genie pops out. But this genie, he's a ni... he's a black guy.

turns.speaker: YAKAVETTA
turns.text: He's a nigger.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Yeah. And uh, he's pissed off. He says, "Why you crackers always gotta find my mother fuckin' pot? And he tells him he's gonna grant all his three wishes but he's gonna give all the black guys...

turns.speaker: YAKAVETTA
turns.text: Continue the joke.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: He says, "What's your third wish?" And the guys says, "I-I want you to beat me half to death."

turns.speaker: VINCENZO
turns.text: Well, it's the funny man. Give it here, package boy.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Joey Bevo said it was important. Said I had to give it to him myself.

turns.speaker: VINCENZO
turns.text: Gimme the fuckin' thing. Now sit the fuck down!

turns.speaker: VINCENZO
turns.text: I'm Rocco. I'm the funny man. Heee Hee. I'm so fuckin' funny. Hee Hee.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: Fuck you Vincenzo.

turns.speaker: VINCENZO
turns.text: Tell me a joke funny man. Hee Hee.

turns.speaker: ROCCO
turns.text: I caught your show down at the velvet room at the Holiday Inn, loved it when you busted into Viva Las Vegas.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What color hair does he have?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Black hair. Paul Michael Glaser.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Making Hutch David Soul?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Right. The blond guy.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: OK. That's wrong.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Dignan, it's --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Plus where's Huggie Bear?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: He's not there. Huggie Bear isn't in every single episode.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I think you might of dreamed this one, Anthony.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: No. It's a real episode. The killer is leading him across the city by calling different pay phones.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: As part of his plan. I don't know why.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: See, that's what I'm saying. It has the logic of a dream.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: The point is the killer always goes, May I speak to Starsky? He says his name.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What does Starsky say?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: He says. This is he.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: This is he?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: No. This is he.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Did you see what I meant about the window?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Kind of. Except we've already got the keys.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: That's true. But what if they change the locks?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Would they do that?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Who knows? That's why I filed it down.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Now that window can never be locked. It's impossible.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: See, your mind is very good with the more mechanical details. Whereas my strength would be --

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: She's really kind of hot.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: She's an attractive older woman.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: It's got a V-8, Dignan.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What do you think the cops have?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Anthony, we'll get two hundred for the coin collection alone. That's less than what it's appraised at.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: But Dignan, do you really know that much about rare coins?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I know about money, Anthony. I know the value of money. Plus the earrings are worth three times that.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: The list, Dignan. I know you remember the list because you signed it. "Things Dignan was not supposed to touch."

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Every valuable item in the house was on that list.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: That doesn't make any difference. I bought those earrings for my mother on her birthday. They have a very special value for her.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Yeah, but I can't be sorting through that shit in the middle of a burglary. There's just not time for it.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Then you shouldn't of gone in there, Dignan. Maybe we should of robbed your house. Did you ever think of that?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Where are you going?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I don't appreciate you ridiculing me.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: How was I ridiculing you?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You're making fun of my family. You know there's nothing to steal from my mom and Craig. You know exactly what you're saying.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: That's not what I meant, Dignan.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Did you see that?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Yeah, I saw it.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I'm lookout.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Dignan, it's got an alarm.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I don't think so. Just reach on in.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: That sets it off.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: No, just do it real quick.  I'll meet you down there.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: It had an alarm.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Yeah, I heard that.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Five, seven, eight dollars.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Holy shit. What'd I tell you?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Eight dollars.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: That's not bad.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: But he didn't say anything.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Hang on a second.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Is it back in?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Loop around real fast.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Just turn right here.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: OK. Escape route. The most important thing you can have is an escape route. Just in case somebody's tailing us. Or even chasing us, as the case may be --

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: You think we're going to be chased?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: That's a good question. No. I don't. I'm just being hypocritical here. However, I will say --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Now. One thing we need to discuss is timing. Timing is absolutely crucial. What are you doing? Anthony!

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Nothing. Go ahead.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Anthony, give me the fucking gun!

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: No, Dignan. It's not your gun. It's all of ours.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Dignan, calm down.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You're out! I'm not working with either one of you!

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Dignan! Stop!

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Calm down. Take a deep breath.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You're right. You're right.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Where's the manager?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Where's the other stocker?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: There's another stocker, right?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: We know there's another stocker.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Is that the manager?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Unlock that door.  Check the aisles.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Holy shit.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: We got it. We got it.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: What about what that guy said?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Oh, shit. That was scary. In the middle of the robbery. The manager looks at me. Right in the eye. And goes, I'm going to remember you.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I swear to God. In a very quiet voice.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Like he meant it.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Like he would find Dignan. One day.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Like I'm going to hunt you down and kill you.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What's wrong with him?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Anthony, he sat in the car and watched a 4-11 in progress. He got what he deserved.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: He was the driver, Dignan. He did what he's supposed to do.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I didn't realize you were so sensitive to Bob's feelings. Considering I did the plans, you're actually lucky you got --

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Don't even say it, man.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Can I get that credit card from you?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I don't like to use that credit card, Dignan.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Because my mom gets the bill.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: She's not going to notice, Anthony.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I don't want to use it.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Well, then cut it in half.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I keep it for emergencies.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Anthony, we're on the run. This is an emergency. It's only fair that...

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: See if mine are in there.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Dignan, those aren't running shoes.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Yes, they are.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Look at the treads on those.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What about them?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: They obviously weren't designed for racing.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Well, those treads stink. You'd blow a knee out racing on those.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Really. OK, Dad. But seriously, Anthony. These are fast shoes.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: You've never had a pair of fast shoes in your life, Dignan.  In fifth grade Dignan used to wear cowboy boots for P.E.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: That's real cool, Anthony. Yeah, I wore boots. My parents wouldn't buy me any $200 running shoes like yours. I wasn't spoiled.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Don't call me spoiled, Dignan.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You were spoiled rotten.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I'll just say it.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I'll say it.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: OK. Go ahead.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: On your marks...  Get set go.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You owe me fifty bucks.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Bob?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Look, man. She didn't know anything about shirts.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: No, I'm not saying her. I'm just saying, I don't know.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: It's a great shirt. Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Armored trucks are very difficult to steal, Anthony.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I know. But once you get inside you're home free.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Right. Get back to me on that one. Once your plan is worth a shit.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: It's not a plan. It's just --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Actually. If you knew the exact route, you could plant explosives under a manhole cover and blow it up as it went over.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Yeah, but you wouldn't have the truck if you blew it up.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: True.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Dignan, I can't get my hair cut. That's just not possible, all right?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Then you're going to have to dye it, Anthony. We've got to hide our identities. Especially after Bob crashed the car.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: No, Dignan. I'm sorry. I can't do that.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Even if it's the difference between some trooper recognizing us and throwing us in prison or not?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I thought you guys went to get your hair cut.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: No. We didn't.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: This is Inez. Carmen. Anita.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Hi.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Inez, this is --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Jerry.  And this is my associate Cornelius.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: May I have a word with you, please?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What the fuck is going on here?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: What. What's the matter?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Anthony, we're on the run from the law here. Did you tell these people your real name?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: No. I didn't. Dignan, they don't speak English.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: They don't?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: No. Not really. Inez speaks a little.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Which one was that?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: On the left.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: She's from Cuba.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: No kidding.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: He needs to hire an attorney.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: No, no. Look. OK. Let's stay here until we find out what's going on.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Now that makes sense. We'll hang out for a couple of days. Get a little R&R. Make sure Future Man's OK and then get back on the road.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: As long as he gets out OK.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Obviously. That's a given.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Bob?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: See, now we've got a plan.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Don't worry about it, Bob.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: See, one day we were playing hot box over at my next door neighbor Mr. Langston's house and Anthony fell in the pool and got knocked unconscious. I had to dive in and save him.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: This was in fourth grade.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Mr. Langston performed cardiopulmonary recitation. CPR. I've never said this before, but frankly I thought Anthony was dead. The veins in his face were all sticking out. His skin was blue. He truly did look dead.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: After that my parents never let me go to Dignan's again.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: They blamed my family for everything. They always said Mr. Langston saved Anthony's life.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: But if it wasn't for Dignan I probably would of died.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Yes... It's true.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: He's gone. He stole the car.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Where was it parked?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Right here.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: That coward. Son of a bitch.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Maybe he just went to the store.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: He took his stuff. He's gone.  I should of seen this. I should of expected it. Bob doesn't have any character.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: He went back for his brother.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: We said 48 hours.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: That's a long time to be in jail.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: When'd he tell you?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: This morning.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Where was I?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: You were asleep.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: He told you and you let him do it.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: He told me because he wanted to know if I wanted to go.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: If you wanted to go? What were you going to do? Just leave me here by myself?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Well, I didn't do it, did I?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: So when you were saying Bob's at the store and acting real surprised, that was just an act. You were just --

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Bob went to help his brother. I understand that and I can't help it if you don't.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I understand that if I had a few more friends like you and Bob I'd be dead.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: If you say so.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: If you'd gone with Bob you'd probably be in Weatherford by now. Of course I'd be here frantically worrying thinking you must of got kidnapped.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I didn't realize you had such an incredible ability to feel sorry for yourself, Dignan.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Well, the world is a little bit colder today.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: We're going over to this bar if you feel like going.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: No. I'm going to swim. I'll see you later.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Why don't you come with us.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I can't believe he just jumped you.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Can you hand me those french fries.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I wish I'd been there.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Would of been nice.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Man. I'm sorry. We just went for a walk --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I don't really feel like talking about it. The only thing I feel like is getting the fuck out of this place.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: We need a car.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I have an idea for that.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Inez has a master key to all these rooms, doesn't she?  Doesn't she?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I don't think we can do that.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I know we can. It's real simple. We go into a room, grab some car keys and --

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: What I'm saying is she wouldn't go for that.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: She doesn't need to know.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I don't know, Dignan. I just --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Look. I'm ready to get the fuck out of here. It's real torture for me to be here. Getting the shit kicked out of me by Mexicans.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Shh.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: No one to back me up. Now I have a good idea. So unless you come up with something better --

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Dignan. I can't do that. All right? I just can't.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I don't think we need any keys, Dignan. I think I can hotwire a car for us.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You don't know how to hotwire.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Yes, I do. Bob taught me.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Bob taught you how to get electrocuted.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: No, I'm serious. He made me a diagram.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I think we better go home.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Don't panic, Anthony.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I'm not. But there's --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You can't just run home every time things get tough. First of all, we've got enough dough to --

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Our money situation is not good.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You're so spoiled. What is "not good" to you? Only a few hundred --

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: We've got sixteen dollars.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: That's not correct.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Sixteen dollars.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Where's the rest?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I had to give some to Inez.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You gave $383 to the goddamn housekeeper! What the fuck is your problem?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: She needed it.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: A $500 tip! For the housekeeper!

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Her name's Inez. Stop calling her the housekeeper.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: That's what she is!

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: I know that. But --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You're in love with the fucking housekeeper!

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Shut up!

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What are you going to do, get married? Have a bunch of little idiot janitor brats! And go around scrubbing the --

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: When'd you get back?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Ah. Couple days ago.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Who's in the car?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: That's Applejack. You want to meet him?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Applejack would of got him anyway. This was just the quicker way.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: You really hit a guy with a bottle?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: I want you to look at this.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: It's big, Anthony. Real big. It's called Hinckley Cold Storage.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: What's Hinckley Cold Storage?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Mr. Henry has an inside source. We call him Steve. That's where we get our information.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Who's Mr. Henry?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: You'll meet him this afternoon. He's helping us set it up.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: What exactly is this place? Freezers?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Right. Freezers. Imported foods.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: What time did he say to be here?

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Right now.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: You could give somebody a concussion.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Let me feel that.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: He seems pretty good.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Dignan. Take it easy.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Bob!

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: He doesn't want to fight.

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: Get out of the way.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: No, Dignan. This isn't --

turns.speaker: DIGNAN
turns.text: No fighting. It wasn't Bob's fault.

turns.speaker: ANTHONY
turns.text: Easy, Dignan. It's OK.
